did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: New Kent County (Va.) Deeds and Land Grant, 1697-1827
did.abstract: This collection forms part of the Robert Alonzo Brock Collection at The Huntington Library, San Marino, California.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Should you wish to quote from or reproduce images of any of the materials, you must write to the Librarian of the Huntington Library, 1151 Oxford Road, San Marino, CA 91108, requesting formal permission to do so. Please note that you do not have to obtain permission if you are quoting fewer than fifty words, or if you are only citing the document. Images made with microfilm-reader printers are for research use only and may not be used for publication without permission.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New Kent County (Va.) Deeds and Land Grant, 1697-1827, Robert Alonzo Brock Collection, Henry E. Huntington Library, San Marino, California.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Robert Alonzo Brock Collection was filmed by The Huntington Library in cooperation with The Library of Virginia with funding provided by The Library of Virginia Foundation with the support of The Roller-Bottimore Foundation and The Robins Foundation. Microfilm received 15 April 2004.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: New Kent County was named either for the English county of Kent or for Kent Island, in the upper waters of the Chesapeake Bay. William Claiborne, a native of Kent who had been drive from Kent Island by Lord Baltimore, was a prominent resident of the New Kent area about 1654 when the county was formed from York County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: New Kent County (Va.) Deeds and Land Grant, 1697-1827. The collection contains four deeds and one land grant, as follows: a deed between Charles Fleming and Cornelius Bagby (?), 1697; a deed between John D. Watkins and Philadelphia C. Watkins, his wife, of the first part and James Semple, of the second part, 1827 Oct. 3; a deed between John P. Gordon and his wife of the City of Richmond and County of Henrico, of the one part, and Archaelaus Hughes of the City of Richmond of the other part, 1805 Nov. 2; a deed between Edwin J. Clopton of the City of Richmond of the one part and Joseph Wade of the County of York of the other part, 1809 Nov. 1; and a land grant of 3,273 acres to Thomas Nelson for the importation of 21 persons, 1719 Feb. 20.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals are located at the Henry E. Huntington Library, San Marino, California.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional New Kent County Land Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.

New Kent County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional New Kent County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
